DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates a class of medical conditions that develop at the site of an existing wound.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis.

Concepts.definition: A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.origin: DCI CRF:  Duke Cancer Institute Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Routine Wound Repair Negation Wound Complication

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Routine Wound Repair Negation Wound Complication
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An unvarying or habitual method or procedure.: Restoration of diseased or damaged tissues naturally by healing processes.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis.

Concepts.definition: An unvarying or habitual method or procedure.
Restoration of diseased or damaged tissues naturally by healing processes.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

PermissibleValues.value: Wound management included an invasive procedure without general or regional anesthesia (such as aspiration of a seroma), readmission for wound care such as intravenous antibiotics, or persistent deep packing for 120 days or longer
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Invasive Procedure Without Anesthesia Procedure Or Hospitalization Or Greater Than or Equal To Integer::120 Day Persistent Deep Packing Material Wound Care Management

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Invasive Procedure Without Anesthesia Procedure Or Hospitalization Or Greater Than or Equal To Integer::120 Day Persistent Deep Packing Material Wound Care Management
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that invades (enters) the body, usually by cutting or puncturing the skin or by inserting instruments into the body.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.: A loss of feeling or awareness caused by drugs or other substances. Anesthesia keeps patients from feeling pain during surgery or other procedures. Local anesthesia is a loss of feeling in one small area of the body. Regional anesthesia is a loss of feeling in a part of the body, such as an arm or leg. General anesthesia is a loss of feeling and a complete loss of awareness that feels like a very deep sleep.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::120: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.: Retained; never-ceasing.: Extending relatively far inward.: A material used in medical and dental practice for filling a natural cavity or deep or tunneled wound. The packing absorbs drainage from the wound so the tissues can heal from the inside out. Without the packing, the wound could close without healing the deep areas of the wound.: Any action taken to for the purpose of helpin

Concepts.definition: A procedure requiring physical intrusion of the body.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
Treatment with a pharmacological substance that produces a loss of feeling.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Retained; never-ceasing.
Extending relatively far inward.

A material used in medical and dental practice for filling a natural cavity or deep or tunneled wound. The packing absorbs drainage from the wound so the tissues can heal from the inside out. Without the packing, the wound could close without healing the deep areas of the wound.

Any action taken to for the purpose of helping a wound heal; this generally involves keeping the affected area clean and dry, and may involve periodic debridement of any necrotic tissue, or washing of the area with antibacterial solution.

PermissibleValues.value: Major wound complication requiring secondary operation under general or regional anesthesia for wound repair (debridement, operative drainage, and secondary wound closure including rotationplasty, free flaps, or skin grafts)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Major Wound Complication Secondary Surgical Procedure Requirement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Major Wound Complication Secondary Surgical Procedure Requirement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.: A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis.: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.: Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

Concepts.definition: Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.
A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis.
Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

Concepts.definition: A medical condition that develops at the site of an existing wound. Examples include swelling, draining, bleeding, formation of hematoma, infection, and necrosis.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
